PUBLISHERS
CMT
26th March, 1964
James A. Fellows, Esq.,
Assistant Director,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
1,34-6 Connecticut Avenue,
Washington, 36, D.C.
Dear Mr. Fellows,
Thank you for your letter of March 18 in which
you request permission, to cover the world in the
English language with the exception of the U.S.A., to
reproduce the poem For A Iamb from the COLLECTED POEMS
of Richard Eherhart.
We should be glad to mrant you permission to
broadcast this poem by the Voice of America to overseas
countries and in countries where local radio stations
may receive the taped programmes through the United
States Information Agency. Also we should be happy
to grant you permission, to cover the above territory,
for the poem to be published in any given country and
distributed free or at cost to radio listeners as well
as for the poem to be subsequently published in a study
booklet to be produced by U.S.I.A. for free distribution
to overseas listeners who request such booklets.
Our fee, to cover the use of the poem in all the
ways stated above, is fen guineas. Please will you
make full acknowledgements to the author, the title of
the work and ourselves as publishers. We should also
be grateful to receive a cony of the study booklet,
when it is published, for our files.
Yours sincerely
Christine Troughton
Permissions Derartment
